heisigStory: By combining the two primitives bound up and mouth, we can easily see how this character can get the meaning of a phrase. After all, a phrase is nothing more than a number of words bound up tightly and neatly so that they will fit in your mouth.
koohiiStory1: Some Japanese phrases are difficult to wrap your mouth around.
koohiiStory2: A bound mouth cannot utter a single phrase.
myStory: câu. điều bao quanh miệng là câu
words:
佳句(かく): beautiful passage of literature
語句(ごく): words, phrases
句(く): phrase, clause, sentence, passage, paragraph, expression, line, verse, stanza, 17-syllable poem
句読点(くとうてん): punctuation marks
俳句(はいく): 17-syllable poem
文句(もんく): phrase, complaint
